• Collaborating with senior engineers and domain experts to translate technical requirements into functional, robust software components.
• BS in Computer Science, Applied Mathematics, Engineering, or a related field with 2 years of experience, or MS in a relevant discipline.
• Demonstrated experience in technical software development (academic, research, or industry projects).
• Strong background in AI/ML frameworks, including experience with large language models.
• Preferred: Knowledge of physics-based simulation tools (LS-DYNA, Ansys), CAD modeling, CFD, real-time simulation, optimization workflows, or generative design.
• Designing, implementing, testing, and maintaining software modules with a focus on integrating AI capabilities into physics-based simulation workflows.
• Refining prototypes for AI-driven features, assisting in their transition from concept to production-ready code.
• Staying current with the latest advancements in AI, machine learning, and simulation technologies, and proposing innovative ideas to enhance product capabilities.

• Minimum Qualifications3+ years working in data science theory and engineeringExpertise and experience in various facets of machine learning, such as classification, feature engineering, information extraction, clustering, semi-supervised learning, topic modeling or rankingProficiency in data science and analytics, including statistical analysis and A/B testingExperience designing, conducting, analyzing, interpreting experiments and investigationsBS in Computer Science or equivalent work related experience.

• You will use your experience and judgment to plan and accomplish goals.
• Collaborate with cross-functional teams to meet software engineering requirements.
